business.headline: India least vulnerable but Trump unpredictable person: Martin Wolf Martin Wolf, speaking on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos, said that India is least vulnerable to Donald Trump's tariff threat.

IT rally saves the day on Dalal Steet; Wipro, Infosys among top gainersThe biggest gainers during the session were IT stocks, with the Nifty IT index rising 2.14%, the highest among all other sectoral indices.

Budget 2025: Why financial services sector needs a 'digital lending' boostBudget 2025 would play a key role in driving the country's economic growth through enhanced credit access to the rural and underserved sectors of the economy.

HDFC Bank Q3 results: Net profit rises 2.2% to Rs 16,736 croreThe private lender reported a 7.6% increase in interest earned, which came to Rs 76,007 crore compared to Rs 70,583 in the same quarter of the previous financial year.

Budget 2025: How government can provide relief to taxpayersBudget 2025 and income tax: The country's vast middle-class population is also calling for the inclusion of tax-saving provisions and deductions under the new income tax regime.

Explained: Why ICICI Prudential shares tumbled 10% after Q3 resultsICICI Prudential share price: The company's share price decline came a day after Q3FY25 results, where it reported a 43% rise in net profit to Rs 326 crore.

Zomato shares down over 23% in a month. Should you buy or avoid?Zomato share price: The food delivery giant's stock price has fallen over 14% in the previous two sessions and over 23% in the past month.

Check latest GMPDenta Water and Infra Solutions IPO: The price band for the IPO of Denta Water has been set at Rs 279-294 per share with retail investors required to invest a minimum of Rs 14,700. Budget 2025: Raghuram Rajan says tax cuts won't solve India's fiscal problemsFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that he is not worried about the reduction in tax rates but instead about the need for more effective government spending, particularly in human capital development.

Stocks to watch today: HCLTech, HDFC Bank, HUL, Tata Communication, ZomatoHDFC Bank, Hindustan Unilever (HUL), and Tata Communication will be announcing their Q3 FY25 results today, hence their stocks will likely see some action.

Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan speaks on Trump's tariffs, job creation and othersFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan highlighted his views on issues like US President Donald Trump's plans to impose tariffs on some countries, including India, and how the economy and job creation is progressing under the Narendra Modi-led central government.

Concern for world, won't benefit US much: Raghuram Rajan on Trump tariff threatSpeaking to India Today TV, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan warned that US President Donald Trump's tariff plans could harm global economic stability, increase costs, and deter foreign investment.
A decade of budget evolution under ModiCoalition dynamics could influence future budgetary decisions, particularly in the welfare sector. Will the government maintain its current priorities?

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Critical issue, needs attention: S Jaishankar to US counterpart on visa delaysDuring his first bilateral meeting with the new US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar raised concerns about the prolonged delays faced by Indian citizens in obtaining US visas.

Jalgaon train accident toll spikes to 13, Rs 1.5 lakh aid announced for victimsPassengers of the Pushpak Express, alarmed by a suspected fire, jumped off the train, and were hit by the Karnataka Express, coming from the opposite direction on an adjacent track.

Third part of knife used to attack Saif Ali Khan found near Bandra lakeThe first part of the 2.5-inch-long knife, which was lodged in Saif Ali Khan's body after the attack, was removed during emergency surgery and another part of the weapon was recovered later.

Elon Musk snipes at OpenAI's Sam Altman over Trump-backed Stargate, he claps backThe clash over Stargate is the latest chapter in a years-long dispute between Elon Musk and Sam Altman, who co-founded OpenAI together.

Behind Samay Raina's rising stardom: Why Indian Gen Zers can't get enough of himIndia's Got Latent, a spin-off of India's Got Talent, is a reality show gaining massive popularity amongst young Indians, who have a preference for dark comedy.

Always open to legitimate return of undocumented Indians, says S JaishankarIndia remains open to the lawful return of undocumented Indians abroad, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said. Speaking about deportations from the US, he emphasised verifying individuals' citizenship while opposing illegal migration.

Republic Day will change how you marry, divorce or live-in in Uttarakhand A Uniform Civil Code in the state from January 26 will reform personal laws across religions, but the transformative exercise faces logistical, social and political challenges

Make Ukraine deal or face high tariffs, sanctions: Trump's threat to RussiaDonald Trump said that he would impose high tariffs and sanctions on Russia if a deal is not reached soon to end the war in Ukraine.

MF Hussain painting row: Delhi court reserves order on plea against art galleryDelhi police informed the court on Tuesday that the said paintings portraying Hindu deities in a controversial manner by artist MF Husain have been seized.

Pushpa 2 OTT release: Will Allu Arjun-film stream on Netflix on January 30?Allu Arjun and director Sukumar's Pushpa 2: The Rule is still running successfully in theatres. Now, reports are rife that the film might be available on Netflix by the end of January.

New wildfire rages near Los Angeles weeks after blaze turned city to infernoThe Hughes fire about 50 miles (80 km) north of Los Angeles further taxed firefighters in the region who have managed to bring two major fires burning in the metropolitan area largely under control.

Trump taps head of his personal security detail to lead US Secret ServiceDonald Trump has selected Sean Curran, his personal security chief, as director of the US Secret Service. Trump praised Curran's leadership and trustworthiness, despite bipartisan recommendations favouring an external candidate for the role.

How a selfie led to top Maoist leader Chalapathi's encounter in ChhattisgarhRamachandra Reddy, better known as Chalapathi, operated in the shadows and led the Maoist attack in Odisha's Nayagarh district in 2008 in which 13 security personnel were killed.

Samsung Galaxy S25 series launched: Price, full specs, featuresThe Samsung Galaxy S25 series has finally launched in India. The latest Samsung Galaxy S25 series comes with a starting price of $799 (around Rs 69,000) in the US. The India prices of the new flagship phones are still under wraps, but you can check out the specs below.

Fire alarm didn't go off until I ran out: Survivor recounts Turkey resort tragedyThe fire at the Grand Kartal Hotel, which claimed at least 76 lives early Monday, stands as one of the deadliest disasters in Turkish history.

Varun Chakravarthy rates his bowling heroics in Kolkata T20I 7 out of 10India vs England, 1st T20I: India spinner Varun Chakravarthy delivered a match-winning performance in the first T20I against England, taking three wickets. However, Varun modestly admitted that there's still room for improvement, rating his Kolkata heroics as just a seven out of 10.

Trump could have been reading from Modi's scriptDonald Trump's debut speech after being sworn in as the 47th President of the US echoed ideas that have been highlighted by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi. From striving to restore the glory of their respective countries to a belief of being the chosen one, here's how both leaders are on the same ideas page.
How can BJP neutralise the edge AAP enjoys in Delhi polls?The BJP hopes that the Congress will dent the AAP's Muslim and Sikh votes, neutralising its 10 and two per cent leads respectively.

Maha Kumbh, Statue of Unity, Lakhpati Didi among 31 tableaux themes for R-DayThe array of vibrant tableaux, celebrating the rich cultural heritage and achievements of India have been selected after an intensive selection process.

Mika Singh offers Rs 1 lakh reward to auto driver for helping Saif Ali KhanSinger Mika Singh promised a reward of Rs 1 lakh to the auto driver who saved Saif Ali Khan's life. The actor even met the driver at the hospital and personally thanked him for his help.

Paradha teaser: Anupama Parameswaran, Darshana Rajendran team up for mystical dramaThe teaser of Paradha, directed by Praveen Kandregula of Cinema Bandi fame, hints at a story rooted in tradition, mystery, and the journey of three women.

Pics: Coldplay leaves for Ahmedabad after rocking Mumbai concert After treating fans to their beautiful concert in Mumbai, Coldplay headed to Ahmedabad for their second leg of the Music of the Spheres tour.

India started their series with a dominant win, clinching the opener of the 5-match series by 7 wickets in Kolkata.

Shami is bowling like a 22-year-old: Arshdeep downplays fresh injury concernsIndia pacer Arshdeep Singh downplayed any fresh injury concerns for Mohammed Shami after the veteran bowler was not named in the playing XI for the first T20I against England in Kolkata.

Abhishek emulates 'guru' Yuvraj Singh, hits India's 2nd fastest fifty vs EnglandAbhishek Sharma destroyed the England bowling attack with a sensational fifty in the first T20I of the 5-match series. Abhishek hit his fifty in just 20 balls, which was second fastest by an Indian player in the format.

Australian Open loss to Jannik Sinner feels like a slap, says Alex de MinaurAustralian tennis star Alex de Minaur was disappointed after losing the men's singles quarter-final to Jannik Sinner at the Australian Open 2025. Minaur said the loss to Sinner felt like a slap across the face.

Varun Chakravarthy continues T20I resurgence, rattles England in KolkataVarun Chakaravrthy continued his sensational run in T20Is. Varun, on Wednesday, rattled the England middle-order. Varun dismissed Harry Brook and Liam Livingstone in the space of 3 balls in the first innings of the game.

Pakistan to deploy at least 17,000 security personnel for Champions Trophy 2025Champions Trophy 2025: Pakistan will deploy at least 17,000 security personnel for the matches of the ICC tournament in Karachi, Lahore and Rawalpindi from February 19.

Arshdeep breaks Chahal's record, becomes India's leading T20I wicket-takerIndia vs England, 1st T20I: Arshdeep Singh struck twice in the powerplay in Kolkata to peg England back. With the double strike, he went past Yuzvendra Chahal's tally for the most wickets by an Indian in the shortest format of the game.

After the Taliban took charge in 2021, women in the country were disallowed from working or playing any sport.

Coldplay's Chris Martin halts concert to joke about letter from Bumrah's lawyersColdplay lead singer Chris Martin paused his Mumbai concert to joke about a 'letter from Jasprit Bumrah's lawyers'. UK band Coldplay performed their final Mumbai show on January 21.

Jannik Sinner demolishes Alex de Minaur to secure semi-final berthAustralian Open 2025: Jannik Sinner advanced to the semi-final of the men's singles at Melbourne Park after beating homw favourite Alex de Minaur 6-3, 6-2, 6-1 at the Rod Laver Arena.

India jersey to feature Champions Trophy logo with Pakistan imprint: BCCIIndian team jersey will feature host Pakistan's names during the Champions Trophy, BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia said on Wednesday, 22 January. Saikia quashed the rumours that the BCCI wanted Pakistan's name to be removed from the Champions Trophy logo for their jersey.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
